items.summary: With female echidnas seemingly creating burrows in random places at this time of the year, wildlife carers warn to keep an eye out for what might be disturbed while doing holiday work on your property.

items.title: Premium beef producers expect to be the main casualty of China's new 55 per cent tariff
items.summary: Australian cattle farmers producing wagyu and Angus beef are likely to be among the hardest hit by China's 55 per cent tariff on exports exceeding a 205,000-tonne quota.

items.title: NSW Police riot squad to carry long-arm firearms at Sydney Ashes series following Bondi attack
items.summary: Officers will carry long-arm firearms as part of a bolstered police presence at the Ashes series in Sydney in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Former Darwin councillor's ex-partner speaks out after guilty domestic violence verdict
items.summary: Former Darwin councillor Paul Arnold was found guilty of domestic violence after a years-long court battle, with his ex-partner refusing to be scared into silence. She said the case was "stressful and deeply humiliating", but facing her abuser had been empowering.

items.title: Middle Percy Island is a 'haven' for sailors, displaying scores of memorabilia from bygone days
items.summary: Middle Percy Island is a rare gem where boaties can come ashore and wander through thousands of mementos left by travellers from across the globe.

items.title: WA's Pilbara region shares a human and shorebird FIFO population
items.summary: Dozens of shorebird species flock to northern WA for summer during their global migration.

items.title: Helen Burnet has defected from the Greens but voters may still be wondering exactly why
items.summary: Helen Burnet fronted the cameras on Friday to announce she was quitting the party she's been a member of for more than 20 years, but it's still not clear exactly why she's made the move.

items.title: Photographs of Men in Love exhibition reveals public glimpses of forbidden love
items.summary: What started as a chance discovery of an old photo at a Dallas antique store has spawned a collection of more than 4,000 images of male couples, more than 100 of which are now on display in Canberra.

items.title: Coffee pods generate thousands of tonnes of waste in Australia. Here's what is being done about it
items.summary: Between 10 and 20 per cent of the 3 million coffee pods Australians consume daily are actually recycled. Here's what's being done to change that.

items.title: Barbecue explosion prompts safety warning after Qld beautician's burns
items.summary: Rachel Dear has a serious warning for anyone using a gas barbecue after she suffered significant face and body burns while cooking on Christmas Eve.

items.summary: Police are searching for offenders, who are believed to have driven past in a silver SUV and fired shots at a young man, before fleeing the scene.

items.title: Tesla loses title of bestselling EV company to BYD as sales drop

items.title: Naomi Osaka loses United Cup match to Maria Sakkari ahead of Australian Open
items.summary: Just over two weeks from the season-opening major, former world number one Naomi Osaka reveals she is not at full health after contracting a viral illness over the Christmas period.

items.title: Mid North Coast brumby program rehomes 160 wild horses across Australia

items.title: Flooded outback Queensland graziers to get $2m government package for fodder drops
items.summary: Floodwaters remain in outback Queensland as graziers start to tally up livestock losses. Major flooding is possible in the north-west, with king tides forecast on the east coast.

items.title: The parts of Myanmar the military junta doesn't want you to see
items.summary: Myanmar's military is holding its first elections since overthrowing a democratically elected government in 2021. But as it aims to portray a sense of normality, signs of the junta's menacing presence are everywhere.

items.title: The moon will loom extra large tonight — but it's not a supermoon

items.title: Red and yellow flags can be dangerously confusing. Is it time to change them?

items.title: World-first as Australian donates organs after self-administering assisted dying medication
